fi.opendemocracy.web
Interface TabNavigator.View

All Superinterfaces:
com.vaadin.ui.Component, java.util.EventListener, com.vaadin.terminal.Paintable, java.io.Serializable, com.vaadin.terminal.Sizeable, com.vaadin.terminal.VariableOwner
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractEntityView, CategoryView, ExpertView, LoginView, ODUserView, OpenDemocracyVotingEntityManagerView.WelcomeView, PropositionOptionView, PropositionView, RepresentationView, VoteView
Enclosing class:
TabNavigator
public static interface TabNavigator.View
extends com.vaadin.ui.Component

Interface for all views controlled by the navigator. Each view added to the navigator must implement this interface.

Method Detail

init

void init(TabNavigator navigator,
          com.vaadin.Application application)
Init view. Convenience method which navigator call before slightly before the view is first time rendered. This is called only once in the lifetime of each view instance. In many cases it is better to construct UI within this method than in constructor as you are guaranteed to get references to application and navigator here.

Parameters:
navigator - Reference to navigator that controls the window where this view is attached to.
application - Application instance this view lives in.

navigateTo

void navigateTo(java.lang.String requestedDataId)
This view is navigated to. This method is always called before the view is shown on screen. If there is any additional id to data what should be shown in the view, it is also optionally passed as parameter.

Parameters:
requestedDataId - Id of the data extracted from URI fragment or null if not given. This is the string that appeards in URI after #viewname/

getWarningForNavigatingFrom

java.lang.String getWarningForNavigatingFrom()
Get a warning that should be shown to user before navigating away from the view. If the current view is in state where navigating away from it could lead to data loss, this method should return a message that will be shown to user before he confirms that he will leave the screen. If there is no need to ask questions from user, this should return null.

Returns:
Message to be shown or null if no message should be shown.
